remarks: The union of the range of a function from an infinite set into the class of finite sets is dominated by its domain.  Deduction form. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
statement:
unirnfdomd.1 $e |- ( ph -> F : T --> Fin ) $.
unirnfdomd.2 $e |- ( ph -> -. T e. Fin ) $.
unirnfdomd.3 $e |- ( ph -> T e. V ) $.
unirnfdomd $p |- ( ph -> U. ran F ~<_ T ) $.
